messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using Go (Golang) and the Gin (github.com/gin-gonic/gin) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/articles/{slug}` with method PUT, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `articles/routers.go`, `ArticleUpdate` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/articles/{slug}` with HTTP method PUT.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a dict of Response Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].responses) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the dict of Response Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

I will examine related parts of the project to infer the structure of error responses and typical response bodies used by this codebase. Specifically, I will search for the implementation or usage pattern of error helpers like NewError and NewValidatorError, as well as the typical article response structure, so I can construct Swagger 2.0 Response Objects that align with the actual runtime payloads. Now I will run a few commands to locate these definitions.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.
